text: My name is Olumuyiwa Kolayemi.
I’m a graduate of AWS re/Start program.

My first role coming from
the program was a cloud systems engineer.

I relocated from Nigeria to Boston
to join my wife here to start a family,
and now I'm working as a Platform Engineer
for almost 10 months now with Slalom Build.

It was a four month training,
very intensive,
but it was very encouraging.
I feel like I felt very supported

with the instructors
and even the other people in the program.

So when I have the interview,
I just have a quick chat

with my instructor that, “Hey,
I have this interview.”

And we just went over
some of the scenarios

that might possibly come out
in the technical interview.
Then I went for the interview.
It was literally what I worked on at night before,
and they were very impressed.
And the IT Manager had to reach out to me

immediately, “Please don’t
take any other offer

because we are writing your offer
right now.”

So being able to learn AWS cloud
and get my first role in the cloud,

I was able to afford what I really want
for my daughter.
And then we were able to do a lot of great stuff

and also support
even family back home in Nigeria.
I've been able to enjoy a lot of very rapid progression
in the course of three years that I started my tech journey.
AWS really changed my life.
My name is Olumuyiwa Kolayemi.
I’m a graduate of AWS re/Start program.

My first role coming from
the program was a class system engineer.
I worked on that role for about a year,
and now I'm working as a Platform Engineer
for almost 10 months now with Slalom Build.

It was a four month training,
very intensive,
but it was very encouraging.
I feel like I felt very supported

with the instructors
and even the other people in the program.

So one of the things about the instructors,
they were very helpful.

When I have the interview,
I just have a quick chat

with my instructor that, “Hey,
I have this interview.”

And we just went over
some of the scenarios

that might possibly come out
in the technical interview.
Then I went for the interview.
It was literally what I worked on at night before,
which was to host a static website.

So I was able to do the same thing
and they were very impressed.
And the IT Manager had to reach out to me

immediately, “Please don’t
take any other offer

because we are writing your offer
right now.”

So being able to learn AWS cloud
and get my first role in the cloud,

I was able to afford what I really want
for my daughter.
And then we were able to do a lot of great stuff

and also support
even family back home in Nigeria.
